result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dazion K Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Defendant's appearance is waived. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial on November 8, 2022 at 8:30am in Branch 11.
Pretrial Scheduling order
Forwarded for signature.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for further proceedings. Defendant's appearance is waived. Court addresses the speedy trial demand. Trial date falls outside of the time frame. Court vacates the scheduled final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case remains in trial posture and is placed on the trial calendar. Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Case remains calendared for bail bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 8:30am in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp: 12.27.22
Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson for Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested final pretrial, jury trial, and bail review dates. Court granted defense request. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury trial, and bail review in Branch 11. Any motions to be filed within 15 days from today's date; motion in limine to be filed 48 hours prior to final pretrial. Final pretrial documents to be filed prior to final pretrial date. Bail/Bond Review scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Bench warrant signed in error.  Cancellation warrant sent to court official.

signed and filed
signed and filed
Bail conditions as previously ordered.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jaspen informed the court that defendant was in custody at his 7/15/2022 non-appearance. Court withdrew the bench warrant. Defendant has new pending felony charges.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
*
Case proceeded to bail bond hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO  JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court removed the 8/8/2022 jury trial from the court's calendar.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant will not be entering a plea on today's date and requests adjournment for trial.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Received & Filed, Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 01-25-2022 by WILLIAM CARPENTER
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court there may be a deferred prosecution resolution to this case; a TAD evaluation has been scheduled.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for deferred prosecution hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer A. Reischl.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BST
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No driving.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dazion K Hamilton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
